name: 18 Strings Of Luv
description: Great songs of the 60’s. Beatles,Zombies, Van Morrison, Carole King, Hollies, Motown and a lot more in shimmering 3 part harmonies.

name: 6 Mile Craic
description: Welcome to Six Mile Craic- a group of musical friends who met playing Irish Trad Music Sessions. Along came the pandemic, sessions and life were shut down, but we found a way for our music to continue. Come on out and hear us for a “Good Craic”! See less Our band name was previously The Piperventilators…and you might know us by that name. With the pandemic, it was time for a change. We wanted a name that more accurately reflected the place we call home. 6 Mile Creek is one of Ithaca’s most beautiful hiking areas. With our play on words, we are now “6 MILE CRAIC” (Craic is a term in the Irish language, meaning “one hellova good time!”) So join us, one and all, for a good time…good music….good friends…..good craic!

name: 86ers
description: Cowpunk from Ithaca

name: Acoustic Cow Tippers
description: Original music and comedic social commentary

name: Afrobeta
description: blending organic and electronic music since 2006

name: Aftermarket
description: Savory covers that you know and love, or don’t know that you love yet: acoustic rock infused with classic R&B and funk.

name: Ageless Jazz Band
description: 17-piece jazz big band

name: Alan Rose
description: The songwriter over the 12-string edge! Performing sans Restless Elements.

name: Alex VanTassel
description: Alex VanTassel’s original songs take inspiration from many music styles, including indie pop, jazz, and alternative rock. A singer/songwriter from Endicott, NY, Alex brings together her voice and keyboard to create and share songs that express her thoughts on society, philosophy, mortality, and the human condition. Her debut album, “Roaches in My Head,” can be found on all major streaming platforms.

name: all caps no spaces
description: Garage jam band! The jam started in 2018 and never stopped. Come watch a bunch of sciency PhD students and post-docs give vent to their bottled up artistic feelings. Side effects may vary.

name: All Strung Out
description: Musical Gems of the 20th century, lyric-wise or dance wise. Also, some clever original songs. Country, pop, jazz standards, Irish songs, Rock and roll, folk…Guilty pleasures. Guitars, dobro, flute, hand percussion. Acoustic for Porchfest.

name: Ariel Arbisser
description: Dramatic pop

name: Auntie Emo’s Intro to Ukulele
description: Introduction to playing ukulele for beginners

name: The Barefoot Ladies
description: Three women singers, close three-part harmony; lots of a cappella, some guitar and uke accompaniment.

name: Barn Spiders
description: awide range of old and new blues, rock, and alt with a slight Neil Young leaning. some originals, and tons of fun.

name: Bethany McLyr
description: Quirky and unique try really hard, but don’t come close to describing the musical stylings of Bethany McLyr. Drawing influence from everything from 20s torch songs, punk and contemporary pop, with roots in Celtic and Scandinavian folk, she weaves magic using her trusty ukulele, penny whistle, mandolin and other instruments.

name: Better Weather String Band
description: Southern old time fiddle tunes with a great groove.

name: Bo Lipari and Friends
description: Ukulele performances by Bo Lipari and friends

name: Bob Roberts Calamity
description: 90’s Alternative Rock that hits you right in the nostalgic feels. Remember staying up late, long after your parents told you to go to sleep? Head nuzzled close to your boombox with a blank tape prepared to record your favorite jams? BRC creates that live; no commercials.

name: Bronwen Exter
description: “COME ALL YE COWGIRLS AND BARFLIES, TRAGIC COMEDIANS AND LAZY POETS, ALL YE DISCIPLES, DEGENERATES, AND DOWAGERS. IF BRONWEN EXTER HASN’T WRITTEN A SONG THAT SPEAKS RIGHT TO YOU YET, IT’S TIME YOU LIVE A LITTLE, DARLIN.” – Megan Romer/ Grassroots

name: Charlie Young
description: Charlie Young, a singer-guitarist with a voice that won’t quit, performs an eclectic selection of pop, folk, rock, swing, western, and country songs.

name: Chimes of Bayonets
description: “Chimes of Bayonets has all the goods. Frayed riffs, throbbing basslines and rhythmic bliss.” Formed in 2016 from Ithaca, New York. Sounds like June of 44 meets Shellac.

name: Citizen O’Kane
description: Citizen O’Kane is a two piece bass/keyboard/drums combo, built on a foundation of rock solid love and soul devotion.

name: Cobra Cadaver
description: We play heavy rock and roll

name: Common Railers
description: Common Railers is original indie rock and American roots music. A rockin’ four-piece band with guitar, upright and electric bass, drums, sax, flute and accordion.

name: Cornell Gamelan Ensemble
description: The Cornell Gamelan Ensemble is dedicated to the study and performance of Central Javanese gamelan music. music.cornell.edu/gamelan

name: Cornell Ukulele Club
description: The Cornell Ukulele club is a student run club to play the Ukulele and teach others to.

name: Cornell University Jazz Ensemble
description: The Jazz Ensemble is the flagship group of the CU Jazz program. Students perform classic, modern, and contemporary repertoire in a large ensemble format. The group has commissioned works from Jim McNeely, Rufus Reid, and Paul Smoker and has performed with many jazz masters such as the late Dizzy Gillespie, Joe Henderson, Barry Harris, and James Moody. More recent guest artists include Maria Schneider, Joshua Redman, Peter Bernstein, and Wynton Marsalis.

name: Dad On Arrival
description: Fun mix of rock, pop and indie, Seriously casual.

name: Dara Anissi
description: We are a two piece band consisting of oud and percussion playing orginal and traditional Middle Eastern Music.

name: Darkwine
description: Darkwine plays classic acoustic songs and deep cuts from the 60s, 70s, 80s, 90s and beyond, with searing instrumentals and delicious vocal harmonies.

name: Dex & friends
description: acoustic rock and pop covers and a few originals

name: Diana Leigh Quartet
description: Diana Leigh and her band of merry musicians play sweet and swinging jazz and blues for your dancing and listening pleasure. With the great Kevin Jones on guitar, Stu Zimny on bass, and Keith Evan Green on drums.

name: Dickie Starfish Allstars
description: Pop and Rock covers from the 60s to the present, performed by cool dads.

name: DJ Evo Evolution
description: Your favorite DJ’s Favorite DJ on wheels

name: Djug Django
description: Ithaca’s fave Gypsy/Blues/Latin/Jug/Swing Band

name: Doolin O’Dey
description: DOOLIN O’DEY— an exciting mix of traditional and original Celtic inspired music. Fiddles, Celtic whistles, Uilleann pipes, Hammer Dulcimer, Guitar, Octave Mandolin, and Piano- in a fresh Celtic sound. You’ll be drawn into the magical arrangements of this band that brings all the finesse of fine Chamber Music and the fire of the Celtic Isles to the Finger Lakes. Doolin O’Dey presents music with grace, flair, elegance and foot stompin’ fun. A much sought after band in the Finger Lakes of NY and beyond. Concert Halls…Performing Arts Centers…. Celtic Festivals….Contra Dances….Museums…Churches…Community Events…Private Parties…Weddings…Wineries

name: Elisa & The YesMen
description: Elisa (Sciscioli) Keeler’s powerhouse vocals combined with the YesMen’s funky soul grooves raise the roof with conscious lyrics that lift the spirit and shake the hips. Keeler’s original songs include R&B, jazz, funk, West African and Latin music influences. The band features Travis Knapp, Jamie Yaman, Mark Karlsen, Rusty Keeler & Jon Keefner.

name: Eric Campbell
description: Acoustic jazz, blues, pop and rock covers

name: Fall Creek Brass Band
description: A community favorite, the Fall Creek Brass Band fuses the sound of New Orleans Street music with funk, jazz, and pop. With a mighty crew of trumpets, trombones, saxes, drums, and a big green sousaphone, FCBB’s powerful sound always attracts a crowd and gets everybody’s feet moving!

name: Fall Crickers Jug Band
description: Perennial faves featuring originals, Western swing, blues and Jug Band nuggets from Colorblind James and Scott Regan

name: Family Values
description: Old Time Family Music

name: Firepit Trio
description: A brand new pop/folk trio with a live-looping twist.

name: Fish OUT-ISH
description: We cover professional wrestling themes from the 80s-current day as well as an array of classic TV theme songs, we wear costumes of wrestlers, and it’s a good time for all ages.

name: Florencia Ulloa
description: Mexican born and Ithaca based singer songwriter, singing originals including songs from her new album, izzysplaylist

name: Foggy Blues Band
description: Blues improv group. Electric. Guitar, violin, bass, harmonica, drums.

name: Freese Road Bandits
description: Ana Florencia on guitar and vocals and keys Jim Payne on cajón Michael Drake on bass

name: Frits Marohn Sextet
description: Jazz group comprised of college students. Standards and more.

name: The Fuse
description: A roaring synth. Shredding guitars. A blonde screaming into the mic. Then ZAP! Silence. Our first open mic night ended abruptly and gave us our name—we blew a fuse. Now we draw on that power, blending grunge, metal, and rock to (hopefully not) short out your neighbor’s porch.

name: Goats in the Woodshed
description: The great Old Time Music you get when a group of Ithaca friends gather to share the tunes they enjoy. Mad Goat Stringband band members Peter, Marianne, Tom and Nancy join with Laura and Scott to give you the Goats in the Woodshed band. Stop on by!!

name: Grace Dashnaw
description: Cello w/ pickup and electronics

name: Hay Day
description: Old time music featuring John Hoffmann, Michelle Delco, David Jones, Sally Freund and Randi Beckmann

name: Hula Hut
description: Authentic hula dancing. Aloha!

name: ICO Brass Quintet
description: The ICO Brass Quintet consists of brass players of the Ithaca Community Orchestra (http://ithacacommunityorchestra.org) who play a wide range of music: classical, marches, overtures, folk song suites, musical soundtracks, jazz and ragtime. Formed in 2009, the ICO Brass Quintet has played various concerts around town, including PorchFests 2012-19.

name: The Immortal Peaches
description: And eclectic mix of rockachili, Psychobilly and jazz soup played on a homemade guitar made out of a candy dish and stepped in Bath tub whiskey and glitter

name: Insolent Cur
description: Acoustic duo playing originals and covers.

name: Isaac Sharp – Guitarist
description: Classical guitar? Song parodies?? Unsettling soundscapes??? Yes! Yes!! YES!!!

name: Ithaca High School Chorale
description: The Ithaca High School Chorale is a non-auditioned ensemble of 10th, 11th and 12th grade singers. They are a diverse group of young people, expert goofballs, and thoughtful student musicians who love singing just about everything.

name: Ithaca Ukes
description: Group performance by the Ithaca Ukulele group

name: Jake and the Nowhere
description: A performance by The Nocturnal Animal Band followed by punk band Jake and the Nowhere

name: Jasperoo
description: Jasperoo perform instrumental Americana music from old-time to modern originals. They play guitar (6 and 12 string) and banjo (4 and 5 string). If the tunes aren’t familiar, they’ll soon be old friends.

name: JazzHappensBand
description: 7-piece traditional hot jazz band

name: Jeremy & Beth
description: Bittersweet ballads and uplifting tunes. Jeremy & Beth have been singing on road trips and around campfires since 2012. Come and hear a few of our favorite cover songs.

name: Johnny Dowd
description: Over the last thirty years, Johnny Dowd has been releasing records that defy trends, creating a unique catalog of work. Now in his seventieth year, Dowd has lost none of the attitude that has seen him forge his position as one of America’s most inquisitive artistic minds.

name: Katie Alessandra
description: A one woman band with high energy bluegrass roots.

name: Kitestring
description: Alternative roots rock with influences from Americana and blues featuring memorable original songs with excellent musicianship and fiery unforgettable vocals.

name: Knockout Rats
description: Knockout Rats are a scrappy, 4 person garage band, primarily playing covers. A fully owned subsidiary of Tyrannical Vegetable, LLC.

name: Lady Shen
description: Jamaican singer & songwriter known for delivering various musical styles.Most of her songs relates to her life experiences and serve as a source of healing and strength. She sings with power and vigor with the hope of helping others through her music. Instagram-ladyshengram, YouTube-Lady Shen, TikTok-Lady_shen, Lady Shen Music avaialable on all major platforms

name: Leo & The Maydays
description: Alternative Indie Rock Infectious melodies and harmonies that draw the listener in and leave them wanting more. Leo can seamlessly bridge the gap between catchy indie rock and jazz inspired numbers.

name: Li’l Anne and Hot Cayenne
description: Deep groove zydeco

name: Louise Henrie with Secondary Dominant
description: Jazz Standards & Songs, Steve Mandl on keyboard and Keith Feldt EWI, with rhythm section David & Tavis Flanagan

name: Luke G & the Candyhearts
description: Luke transports us to a decade that never was, with echoes of the 1950s era of rock ‘n’ roll and doo-wop, but a time & place like none before. Despite the name, there’s no saccharine in the Candyhearts. Just unrefined sonic truth, barely hinged, desperate to make memories & make some people move.

name: Magz1lla
description: Magz1lla is an electro-pop act with synthy beats, silvery vocals, and introspective lyrics.

name: Material Objects F&F
description: Indie and post-punk for porchgoers. Adapted lineup with friends and family.

name: Max Childs
description: Singer/Songwriter performing a blend of Pop, Soul, and RnB

name: Meadow
description: Meadow is a producer and dj whose sound is inspired by house, techno and ambient music. their work is about finding and cultivating feeling, especially as a means of reacting to and articulating life with brain disorders.

name: Metasequoia
description: Rock Reggae Fusion Organic grown grooves

name: Microbes, Mostly
description: We are microbes (mostly). Fast paced garage rock inspired by scobies and compost piles everywhere. It’s music you can move your feet to! Yeehaw!

name: Mighty Jet
description: The Mighty Jet is a blend of blues, folk, and rock. They play lyric-driven original songs, with guitars, banjo, keyboards, and drums creating a kind of swampy rumination. The band has been described as “deft and spontaneous,” and stands accused of perpetrating their own brand of intelligent blues.

name: Mobile Genetic Elephants
description: The transfer of musical ideas via mobile genetic elephants allows musicians to adapt rapidly to changing environmental pressures. Here we present a novel in vivo study observing original songwriters in their natural acoustic ecosystem.

name: Mushroom House
description: Introspective folk rock with harmonies, guitar, and foot-stompin’ fun.

name: Nasturtium
description: Father / Son duo present instrumental rock.

name: Negative Stars
description: Noir nouveau punk rock duo.

name: NEO Project
description: NEO Project is a funked up jazzy soulful, high energy dance band rooted in funky R&B grooves, Afro Cuban/Caribbean rhythms & bluesy soul music. Its members have built a collective reputation as to always giving the listener a powerful dose of deep pocket grooves, soulful melodies & blazing improvisation.

name: New Motor Club
description: “The music, it’s rock and roll. it’s putting the hammer down and still having this sense of vulnerability. So familiar in the best way possible. The choruses, no way to say it but they are f***ing catchy. It’s a big hook. It’s got you. It’s stuck there forever.” -Jimmy Hollywood

name: Noon Fifteen
description: Hailed as “a small town band with a big imagination” (Pete Mason, NYS Music), Ithaca, NY’s genre-bending soul combo, Noon Fifteen, delivers fun, forward-thinking songs bathed in layered vocals and old school instrumentation.

name: Northside Stringband
description: Old time string band from Ithaca’s Northside neighborhood

name: Not From Wisconsin
description: Original songs that range from spare and meditative to hook-driven indie rock.

name: Off the Rails
description: Off the Rails will be doing an acoustic set in keeping with the spirit of Porchfest, playing a mix of originals and covers.

name: Old Scots
description: Original music, an Eccelctic mix of progressive folk and rock with some jazz influence. John, Steve and Craig first played together in 1971 and – with a few interruptions – continue to create music to this day.

name: Old Time Club
description: Old Time fiddle and banjo music

name: One Heart Community Drumming
description: Ithaca’s community drum circle since 1996

name: Opus Ithaca Jazz
description: Students from Opus Ithaca School of Music summer program perform jazz standards.

name: The Original Cornell Syncopators
description: Founded in 2016 by Colin Hancock, the Original Cornell Syncopators is a Cornell student-run jazz band specializing in sweet and hot music from the late 1910s to the early 1930s. It is now led by Zeke Lawrence and features danceable tunes for the whole family.

name: Pamela Goddard/HarpSong
description: Solo soothing harp and gentle folk songs – pull up a chair and relax. Totally acoustic, very intimate.

name: Papa Muse (solo)
description: Described as “Indie World,” Papa Muse blends rock and world music with catchy hooks and funky dance-able grooves.

name: Pelotones
description: The Pelotones play a variety of Swing jazz, R and B, Blues and originals. Good for dancing.

name: Penelope-Myles Voss
description: Penelope-Myles Voss is a vocalist and songwriter who studied music at Ithaca College. She bought her first ukulele at Hickey’s in Ithaca a year after graduation, and hasn’t stopped playing it since. Her songs are bittersweet and speak to themes of loss, hope and the search for identity.

name: Pete’s Pop-Up Porch Pickers and Square Dance!
description: Fiddle tunes on the porch, square dancing in the Street. Gonna be a big time — y’all come.

name: The Philip Glass Cover Band
description: A collective of wind/string/percussion musicians playing arrangements of Philip Glass pieces.

name: Pine box
description: string band music

name: Plaster Men
description: Your new favorite Ithaca’s power pop super group playing tunes that sound familiar but you actually never heard them before.

name: Prof. Tues. Jazz Quartet
description: Mainstream jazz quartet featuring Peter Forlano on sax, Jerry Hilliker on guitar, John Sanderson on drums, and Rob Sarachan on bass.

name: Proper Philth
description: Funk/Disco/House (DJ set)

name: Prow
description: Four musicians from varying backgrounds that love crafting good music. We strive to create stories with strong imagery, inspired by 80’s pop and 90’s/2000’s style rock and alternative music.

name: Quaker Midnight
description: “Quaker Midnight” is a husband and wife duo from the Philadelphia area performing their original acoustic arrangements of folk, rock, blues, pop, and jazz songs. George Schaefer (he/him) guitar/vocals, and Georgette Hamaty (she/her) vocals have been performing together for 13 years. They love Ithaca, frequently visiting their daughter at Cornell.

name: Richie and Rosie
description: Fiddle and banjo old time Appalachian americana

name: Richie Holtz and Friends
description: We’ll be playing acoustically. Songs you know and songs you may not know. Feel free to sing along.

name: Rose Fritzky-Randolph
description: Rose Fritzky-Randolph is overjoyed to be singing from her favorite Ithaca porch once again! A singer-songwriter influenced by folk rock artists like Joni Mitchell and Brandi Carlile, Rose has been in the Ithaca music scene for the last decade. Supported by some of her long time musical soul mates, she’ll be performing a set of her original songs as well as a couple favorite covers. Happy Porchfest!

name: The Rudiments
description: A bunch of amateur, rudimentary musicians that enjoy making music together. We cover songs from the likes of Tom Petty to Shovels and Rope to the Avett Brothers. Come join us for an hour to celebrate the return of Porchfest!!!!

name: Sam Money
description: Solo acoustic loop pedal originals and covers ranging from classic rock to funk to bluegrass

name: Sandbox
description: Mix of eclectic rock and originals.

name: Scratched Vinyl
description: Rock-n-Roll originals and covers

name: Sears St. Ally Cats
description: Magnus and Suzanne Schwartz met while working at Cornell Libraries. They perform various cover tunes. Pete Magnus Vocals Uke Guitar Suzanne Schwartz Bassettino Uke Mandolin

name: Second Spring
description: Local rock group with heavy influences from classic rock, formed in 2019. Setlist includes both original music and covers. https://www.instagram.com/secondspringithaca/?hl=en

name: Seneca St. Recorder Ensemble
description: Lively, lovely, fun music for recorder ensemble. Appealing selections from folk traditions and Renaissance to contemporary composers.

name: Shinichi and the ITEs
description: Fiddle, folk and fun tunes by violin and viola players ages 4-17.

name: Silas Brainard and the Ants on Stilts
description: Silas Brainard and the Ants on Stilts is an Ithacan folk-rock group. Their debut album, “Trip to Newfield”, is a collection of originals released in March, with songs rich in vocal harmony, about coming of age, existential confusion, moving, pain, loss and acceptance. A second album coming soon.

name: Singing Heart Kirtan
description: Kirtan is a joyful practice of call-and-response singing from the yoga tradition. We chant mantras and prayers that open the heart and lift the spirit. Led by Jyoti (Jody Kessler)and friends. (with Sparky the Unicorn)

name: Singing Notes And Slinging Jokes
description: It is Singing Notes and Slinging Jokes when SingTrece, and comedian, Kenneth McLaurin share a stage together. International performing and recording artist, “SingTrece” and husband Kenneth McLaurin are excited to bring you a great evening of entertainment. Partners in life, and creativity they merge, music, song, storytelling, and comedy, into an intimate experience which is an invitation as the couple, takes you on a journey of songs and stories about life, love, and laughter.

name: SingTrece
description: Live performer, soul singer. Changing hearts one positive note at a time

name: Sonic Rust
description: Neil Young and Crazy Horse covers from the early 70’s to now. Danceable and memorable.

name: The Soul Benders
description: The Soul Benders defy the norm and deliver a powerhouse celebration of originals filled with blues and rock as well as many soul-filled covers. Emerging from their originals, you’ll find songs of universal resonance that get your feet tapping, your mind humming and your heart pumping.

name: Stone’s Throw Creek
description: Porchfest favorites since 2008, Stone’s Throw Creek will entertain you with original compositions and standards borrowed from bluegrass, country, and the Grateful Dead — all done in bluegrass style with tight vocal harmonies!

name: Story Porch for Grown-Ups
description: Pithy tales from an all-star lineup of local storytellers

name: Story Porch for Kids
description: Tales for young folk by local tellers

name: Stranded With a Kiss
description: 3 piece original rock

name: Strong Maybe
description: Strong Maybe is a band from Ithaca, NY. Mostly improvised psychotic cartoon animal music.

name: Sue and Alejandro
description: Sue Smith and Alejandro Papachryssanthou bring you something pretty unique: our favorite jazz tunes played adventurously and soulfully on chromatic harmonica and keyboard. Latin, Brazilian, standards…Both long time local music teachers and performers with eclectic backgrounds. Come listen!

name: the sunny weather
description: Songwriter, Trevor MacDonald, is an acoustic Americana, indie pop, artist who performs as the sunny weather. Trevor is a self taught musician who began making music at the age of 15 while living in California. A year later he returned to Ithaca, New York and released a debut cassette. This led to years working with roots rock band Donna the Buffalo and the GrassRoots Festival scene.

name: Taksim
description: We are a Middle Eastern music and Belly Dance band in Ithaca, New York. We have collaborated with musicians and dancers from Egypt, Iran, Syria, Lebanon, Iraq, Tunisia, Greece, Turkey, and Armenia. We perform music loved by people from the Middle E and Mediterranean and the Balkans. Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCMcWjt3NbAl5olVyD9Mbl5A

name: Tenzin Chopak
description: Tenzin Chopak is a singer songwriter and artist based in Ithaca. He’ll be performing with Emmett Scott on keys and Cooper Casterline on percussion.

name: There’s Always Room for Cello!
description: Delightfully mellow and lively cello tunes by players ages 4-17.

name: Timothy Weber Gets Help
description: Solo singer-songwriter playing duets for once – favorite covers and most-requested originals for bouncy fun and heartfelt vibes. Guitars plus.

name: Toivo
description: Toivo plays an eclectic mix of danceable music from accordion driven Tex-Mex polkas to waltzes, tangos, and honky-tonk country. Richard Koski, accordion; Jason Koski, mandolin; Jim Reidy, guitar; Stefan Senders, banjo; Harley Campbell, upright bass; Annie Campbell, snare drum.

name: Tom Mank and Sera Smolen
description: Original modern folk and blues with improvised cello. Tom Mank – acoustic guitar, vocal Sera Smolen – cello Rick DePaolo – acoustic guitar Kirsti Gholson – vocal https://tommank.net/

name: Tom Shevory and Chris Bell
description: Piano driven rock-n-roll originals. Inspired by the upright’s pedigree, but smitten by the digital’s versatility.

name: Travis Knapp & Friends
description: Banjo-based original folk music, with lots of soulful singalongs & 3-part harmonies @travisknappmusic

name: Trillium Recorder Trio
description: This year we’re playing International Music from around the world, ending with American spirituals, blues and “The Sycamore Suite” by Scott Joplin.

name: Truth Decay
description: Rock originals from the minds of adults struggling to act their age.

name: VESTMENTS
description: VESTMENTS is athena rajnai and wallace petruziello. we write songs together in Ithaca, NY, & our friends help us play them live. hopefully you find something within our music that you can wear around yourself. instagram/twitter: @vestmentsband

name: VINYL DJ Collective
description: Few mates casually spinning eclectic vinyl selections.

name: Vivace Vocal Quartet
description: Vivace is an acapella vocal quartet singing songs ranging from swing to country. The fun is baked into the close harmony and toe tapping rhythm!

name: Wallnut
description: Eclectic mix of Rock and Roll covers.

name: Wayne Gottlieb solo
description: Wayne (of the Pelotones) will play some of his original songs and chord solos. He will have a looper, though he may decide not to use it.

name: Will Fuedman
description: Will Fudeman playing mostly originals, with heart, humor, mandola and guitar, and whatever friends are free to stop by and join for a few tunes.
